jparsec.time

Class DateTimeOps

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.time.DateTimeOps

  • public class DateTimeOps
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains miscellaneous time and date-related functions.

    Functions related to Daylight Saving Time work using the current system settings, so its depends on the computer.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain), M. Huss

    • Method Detail

      • dstOffset

        public static float dstOffset(java.util.Calendar cal)
        Calculate the current Daylight Time offset ( 0 or -1 ).
        Add the result of this function to the current time to adjust.
        Parameters:
        cal - A java.util.Calendar object which is used to get the DST_OFFSET from (e.g., java.util.GregorianCalendar).
        Returns:
        DST_OFFSET in hours if Daylight time is in effect, 0 otherwise.

      • dstOffset

        public static float dstOffset()
        Calculate the current Daylight Time offset.
        Add the result of this function to the current time to adjust.
        This function uses a GregorianCalendar object.
        Returns:
        DST_OFFSET in hours if Daylight time is in effect, 0 otherwise.

      • dstOffsetInDays

        public static double dstOffsetInDays(java.util.Calendar cal)
        Calculate the current Daylight Time offset in fractional days.
        Add the result of this function to the current time to adjust.
        Parameters:
        cal - A java.util.Calendar object which is used to get the DST_OFFSET.
        Returns:
        DST_OFFSET in days if Daylight time is in effect, 0 otherwise.

      • dstOffsetInDays

        public static double dstOffsetInDays()
        Calculate the current Daylight Time offset in fractional days.
        Add the result of this function to the current time to adjust.
        This function uses a GregorianCalendar object.
        Returns:
        DST_OFFSET in days if Daylight time is in effect, 0 otherwise.

        Parameters:
        cal - The Calendar to use.
        Returns:
        The offset in hours.

        Returns:

      • isLeapYear

        public static boolean isLeapYear(int year)
        Returns true if the year is a leap year in the Gregorian Calendar.
        Parameters:
        year - Year value, as it is given by an AstroDate instance (-2 = 2 B.C. not the 'astronomical' year).
        Returns:
        true if it is a leap year, false otherwise.

      • getDaysInMonth

        public static int getDaysInMonth(int year,
                 int month)
        Returns the number of days in a given month in the Gregorian calendar.
        Parameters:
        year - Year value, as it is given by an AstroDate instance (-2 = 2 B.C. not the 'astronomical' year).
        month - Month.
        Returns:
        Days in month.

      • getLastSundayOfApril

        public static double getLastSundayOfApril(int year)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Calculate the Julian day number for the date when Daylight time starts in a given year in some countries of the north hemisphere, or ends in other countries in the southern one.
        Parameters:
        year - The year of interest.
        Returns:
        The corresponding Julian day.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the day is invalid.

        Parameters:

                                   throws JPARSECException
        Calculate the Julian day number for the date when Daylight time starts in a given year in some countries in the north hemisphere, or ends in others in the southern one.

        The corresponding Julian day.
        Throws:

      • getLastSundayOfOctober

        public static double getLastSundayOfOctober(int year)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Calculate the Julian day number for the date when Daylight time ended in a given year (before 2007) in United States and other countries.

        Note that as of August 2005 law, approved by the congress of the USA, now the DST ends in the first Sunday of November in that country and Canada, except in the following regions that maintain the previous rule: Arizona, Hawai, Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, and American Samoa.

        Parameters:
        year - The year of interest.
        Returns:
        The corresponding Julian day.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the day is invalid.

      • getFirstSundayOfNovember

        public static double getFirstSundayOfNovember(int year)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Calculate the Julian day number for the date when Daylight time ends in a given year (2007 and after) in United States.
        Parameters:
        year - The year of interest.
        Returns:
        The corresponding Julian day.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the day is invalid.

      • getSecondSundayOfMarch

        public static double getSecondSundayOfMarch(int year)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Calculate the Julian day number for the date when Daylight time starts in a given year (2007 and after) in United States.
        Parameters:
        year - The year of interest.
        Returns:
        The corresponding Julian day.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the day is invalid.

      • getFirstSundayOfApril

        public static double getFirstSundayOfApril(int year)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Calculate the Julian day number for the date when Daylight time started in a given year (before 2007) in United States and Canada. Note that as of August 2005 law, approved by the congress of the USA, now the DST starts in the second Sunday of March.

        Please note that the new 'rule' is not applied in the whole USA, for example in Arizona, Hawai, Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, and American Samoa.

        Parameters:
        year - The year of interest.
        Returns:
        The corresponding Julian day.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the day is invalid.
